IPDR_Status Log_CheckLogLevel (  Log *  L,
IPDR_ModuleID  ModuleID,
IPDR_DebugLevel  Lvl
) 
 

The function checks whether a specific module within the client (transmitter) outputs log messages at the given level.

Parameters:
L log
ModuleID module identifier (either IPDR_PLATFORM_MODULE_ID or #IPDR_HOST_MODULE_ID)
Lvl the level to test against
Returns:
1 if the module is outputing log messages at the requested level, 0 otherwise 
00602 {
00603     if (L && L->Enabled &&
00604         ((Module *) L->Modules.Data[ModuleID])->Level >= Lvl)
00605         return IPDR_ERR;
00606     return IPDR_OK;
00607 }

IPDR_Status Log_CheckLogLevelByName (  Log *  L,
const char *  Name,
IPDR_DebugLevel  Lvl
) 
  

00279 {
00280     int i;
00281     Module *M;
00282 
00283     for (i = 0; i < L->Modules.Length; i++) {
00284         M = (Module *) L->Modules.Data[i];
00285         if (M == NULL || M->Name == NULL)
00286             continue;
00287         if (Name != NULL && ! strcmp(Name, M->Name)) {
00288             return Log_CheckLogLevel(L, i, Lvl);
00289         }
00290     }
00291 
00292     /* Unknown module name: use default */
00293     return Log_CheckLogLevel(L, IPDR_PLATFORM_MODULE_ID, Lvl);
00294 }

Console function for getting module debug level

Parameters:
S console session
Out output stream
Argc number of arguments
Argv arguments
Arg context argument (log)
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 
00407 {
00408     Module *M;
00409     int i;
00410     Log *L = (Log *) Arg;
00411 
00412     if (Argc == 0) {
00413         for (i = 0; i < L->Modules.Length; i++) {
00414             M = (Module *) L->Modules.Data[i];
00415             if (M == NULL || M->Name == NULL)
00416                 continue;
00417             Console_Println(S, Out, "%-10s: %d", M->Name, M->Level);
00418         }
00419     } else {
00420         for (i = 0; i < L->Modules.Length; i++) {
00421             M = (Module *) L->Modules.Data[i];
00422             if (M == NULL || M->Name == NULL)
00423                 continue;
00424             if (! strcmp(M->Name, Argv[0])) {
00425                 Console_Println(S, Out, "%-10s: %d", M->Name, M->Level);
00426                 break ;
00427             }
00428         }
00429     }
00430 
00431     return IPDR_OK;
00432 }

00126     if (FAILURE(Status))
00127         return Status;
00128

00130     if (FAILURE(Status))
00131         return Status;
00132 
00133     Platform_CreateUDPSocket(PS, & L->LogFD);
00134 
00135     Status = Log_RegisterModule(L, IPDR_HOST_APP_MODULE_ID, "Host");
00136     if (FAILURE(Status))
00137         return Status;
00138 
00139     return Log_RegisterModule(L, IPDR_PLATFORM_MODULE_ID, "Platform");

IPDR_Status Log_OutputMessage (  Log *  L,
const char *  Msg,
IPDR_ModuleID  ID,
IPDR_DebugLevel  Level,
const char *  Func
) 
  

00649 {
00650     IPDR_Time c;
00651     int i;
00652     Platform_GetTime(LOG_PLATFORM, &c);
00653 
00654     for (i = 0; i < L->saveI; i++) {
00655         if (L->save[i].level == Level &&
00656             L->save[i].moduleID == ID &&
00657             0 == strncmp(Msg, L->save[i].str, sizeof L->save[i].str) &&
00658             0 == strcmp(Func, L->save[i].func)) {
00659             IPDR_Status rc = IPDR_OK;
00660             L->save[i].repeats++;
00661             if (L->save[i].repeats >= LOG_MAX_REPEATS ||
00662                 c - L->save[i].firstTime >= LOG_MAX_REPEAT_INTVL) {
00663                 rc = Log_OutputMessage2(L, L->save[i].repeats, L->save[i].str,
00664                                         L->save[i].moduleID, L->save[i].level, L->save[i].func);
00665                 for (; i < L->saveI; i++) {
00666                     L->save[i] = L->save[i+1];
00667                 }
00668                 L->saveI--;
00669             }
00670 
00671             return rc;
00672         }
00673     }
00674 
00675     if (L->saveI >= (LOG_SAVE_STR_NUM - 1)) {
00676         if (L->save[0].repeats > 0) {
00677             (void)Log_OutputMessage2(L, L->save[0].repeats, L->save[0].str,
00678                                      L->save[0].moduleID, L->save[0].level,
00679                                      L->save[0].func);
00680         }
00681         for (i = 0; i < (LOG_SAVE_STR_NUM-1); i++) {
00682             L->save[i] = L->save[i+1];
00683         }
00684         L->saveI--;
00685     }
00686     L->saveI++;
00687     L->save[L->saveI].repeats = 0;
00688     L->save[L->saveI].firstTime = c;
00689     L->save[L->saveI].level = Level;
00690     L->save[L->saveI].moduleID = ID;
00691     L->save[L->saveI].func = Func;
00692     strncpy(L->save[L->saveI].str, Msg, sizeof L->save[0].str);
00693 
00694     return Log_OutputMessage2(L, 0, Msg, ID, Level, Func);
00695 }

static IPDR_Status Log_OutputMessage2 (  Log *  L,
int  repeats,
const char *  msg,
IPDR_ModuleID  ID,
IPDR_DebugLevel  Level,
const char *  Func
)  [static]
  

00704 {
00705     int notYetOutput = 1;
00706     Module *M = (Module *) L->Modules.Data[ID];
00707 
00708     /* The old code mapped FATAL=>2, ... DEBUG2=>7, calculated by:
00709        #define SYSLOG_FACILITY 184
00710        int SyslogPriority = SyslogSeveretyMapping[Level] | SYSLOG_FACILITY
00711        and printed this priority as the first field.
00712        This has been changed to output a string.
00713     */
00714 
00715     if ((L->LoggerAddr != 0 && L->LoggerPort != 0) ||
00716         (L->OutputCallback && ! L->BypassCallback)) {
00717 /*
00718         Need to format in standard RFC 3164 form ... the "module" must be no more than 32 characters, terminated by ":" (not part of the 32)  ...
00719             note date format (with extra blank) and that it is LOCAL time
00720             ... total packet must be <= 1024 bytes
00721             ... note addition of "IPDR_" to beginning of "module"
00722             ... the "priority" item at the beginning (in angle brackets) is
00723             ... facility * 8 + severity, so facility=19 (local3) error = 155
00724           <155> Jul  1 17:23:47 192.168.8.88 IPDR transmitter: Exporter_TriggerEvent: Connected(START): Server=10.0.0.213, Port=15001, outstanding=0, unACKed=100, Session=101 [session1] (NE/one)Connected: 10.0.0.40
00725 */
00726 
00727         if (0 && repeats > 0) {
00728             sprintf(L->msgStrWithHdr, "%.7s <%.40s> [%-8.8s] %.99s: (repeated %d times) %.199s\n",
00729                     SyslogSeverityMapping[Level],
00730                     L->ComponentName, M->Name, Func, repeats, msg);
00731         } else {
00732             if (1) {
00733                 int priority = L->LoggerFacility * 8;
00734                 char timeStrBuf[IPDR_TIME_FORMAT_LENGTH];
00735                 switch (Level) { /* translate to RFC 3164 values */
00736                 case IPDR_LEVEL_FATAL:   priority += 0; break; /* emergency     */
00737                 /* case xxx:              priority += 1; break; |* alert         */
00738                 /* case xxx:              priority += 2; break; |* critical      */
00739                 case IPDR_LEVEL_ERROR:   priority += 3; break; /* error         */
00740                 case IPDR_LEVEL_WARNING: priority += 4; break; /* warning       */
00741                 default:                  priority += 5; break; /* notice        */
00742                 case IPDR_LEVEL_INFO:    priority += 6; break; /* informational */
00743                 case IPDR_LEVEL_DEBUG:
00744                 case IPDR_LEVEL_DEBUG2:  priority += 7; break; /* debug         */
00745                 }
00746                 if (! L->LoggerMachineName || L->LoggerMachineName[0] == '\0') {
00747                     /* see Log_SetLoggerAddress for similar code. */
00748                     char hostnameBuf[257];
00749                     Platform_GetHostName(LOG_PLATFORM, hostnameBuf, sizeof hostnameBuf);
00750                     Util_StrDup(LOG_PLATFORM, hostnameBuf, & (L->LoggerMachineName));
00751                 }
00752                 sprintf(L->msgStrWithHdr, "<%d> %.99s %.255s %.32s: %.99s[%.99s]: %.199s",
00753                         priority, Platform_FormatTimeSyslogNow(LOG_PLATFORM, timeStrBuf),
00754                         L->LoggerMachineName, L->ComponentName, Func, M->Name, msg);
00755             } else { /* older format, not used */
00756                 sprintf(L->msgStrWithHdr, "%.7s <%.40s> [%-8.8s] %.99s: %.199s\n",
00757                         SyslogSeverityMapping[Level],
00758                         L->ComponentName, M->Name, Func, msg);
00759             }
00760         }
00761 
00762         if (L->LoggerAddr != 0 && L->LoggerPort != 0 &&
00763             SUCCESS(Platform_SendTo(LOG_PLATFORM, L->LogFD, L->msgStrWithHdr,
00764                                         strlen(L->msgStrWithHdr),
00765                                         L->LoggerAddr, L->LoggerPort))) {
00766             /* output to syslog via UDP is in addition to any output
00767              * to callback or print */
00768             if (0) {
00769                 notYetOutput = 0;
00770             }
00771         }
00772 
00773         if (L->OutputCallback && ! L->BypassCallback) {
00774             L->OutputCallback(L->msgStrWithHdr, L->OutputCallbackArg);
00775             notYetOutput = 0;
00776         }
00777     }
00778 
00779     if (L->OutputCallbackDetailed && ! L->BypassCallback) {
00780         if (repeats > 0) {
00781             sprintf(L->msgStrWithHdr, "(repeated %d times) %.199s",
00782                     repeats, msg);
00783             L->OutputCallbackDetailed(Level, SyslogSeverityMapping[Level],
00784                                       L->ComponentName, M->Name, Func,
00785                                       L->msgStrWithHdr,
00786                                       L->OutputCallbackArg);
00787         } else {
00788             L->OutputCallbackDetailed(Level, SyslogSeverityMapping[Level],
00789                                       L->ComponentName, M->Name, Func,
00790                                       msg,
00791                                       L->OutputCallbackArg);
00792         }
00793         notYetOutput = 0;
00794     }
00795 
00796 #ifdef STD_FILE_OPERATIONS_SUPPORT
00797     if (notYetOutput) {
00798         char timeStrBuf[IPDR_TIME_FORMAT_LENGTH + 1];
00799         if (repeats > 0) {
00800             fprintf(stderr, "%.30sZ %.7s <%.40s> [%-8.8s] %.99s: (repeated %d times) %.199s\n",
00801                     Platform_FormatTimeGMTNow(LOG_PLATFORM, timeStrBuf),
00802                     SyslogSeverityMapping[Level],
00803                     L->ComponentName, M->Name, Func, repeats, msg);
00804         } else {
00805             fprintf(stderr, "%.30sZ %.7s <%.40s> [%-8.8s] %.99s: %.199s\n",
00806                     Platform_FormatTimeGMTNow(LOG_PLATFORM, timeStrBuf),
00807                     SyslogSeverityMapping[Level],
00808                     L->ComponentName, M->Name, Func, msg);
00809         }
00810         fflush(stderr);
00811     }
00812 #endif
00813     return IPDR_OK;
00814 }

IPDR_Status Log_RegisterModule (  Log *  L,
IPDR_ModuleID  ID,
const char *  Name
) 
 

Register a new module within the log service

Parameters:
L logger
ID module id (unique within the system)
Name module name (unique within the system)
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 
00193 {
00194     Module *M;
00195     IPDR_Status Status;
00196 
00197     if (L->Modules.Length > ID &&
00198         L->Modules.Data[ID] != NULL)
00199         return IPDR_ERR;
00200 
00201     Status = Object_Allocate(LOG_PLATFORM, sizeof(Module),
00202                              Module_Destructor, (void **) & M);
00203     if (FAILURE(Status))
00204         return Status;
00205     strncpy(M->eyecatcher, "MODULE ", sizeof M->eyecatcher);
00206 
00207     Status = Util_StrDup(LOG_PLATFORM, Name, & (M->Name));
00208     if (FAILURE(Status)) {
00209         Object_Release(LOG_PLATFORM, M);
00210         return Status;
00211     }
00212 
00213     Status = DynamicArray_SetElementAt(LOG_PLATFORM, & (L->Modules),
00214                                        ID, M);
00215     if (FAILURE(Status)) {
00216         Object_Release(LOG_PLATFORM, M);
00217         return Status;
00218     }
00219 
00220 #if 1 && defined(DEBUG_MODE)
00221     M->Level = IPDR_LEVEL_INFO;
00222 #else
00223     M->Level = IPDR_LEVEL_WARNING;
00224 #endif
00225 
00226     return IPDR_OK;
00227 }

IPDR_Status Log_SetLoggerAddress (  Log *  L,

unsigned int  Facility,

) 
 

Set the Logger IP Address.

Parameters:
L log
Addr The logger IP address
Port The logger output port number.
Facility The "facility", as defined for SYSLOG.
MachineName The client's (trasnmitter's) identification, as defined for SYSLOG.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 
00564 {
00565     IPDR_Status Status;
00566     char hostnameBuf[257];
00567 
00568     L->LoggerAddr = Addr;
00569     L->LoggerPort = Port;
00570     L->LoggerFacility = Facility;
00571     if (! MachineName || MachineName[0] == '\0') {
00572         /* Try to guess the machine's IP address. ' */
00573         /* MachineName = TL_PrintAddress(TCPTransport.LocalAddr, paBuf); */
00574         Platform_GetHostName(LOG_PLATFORM, hostnameBuf, sizeof hostnameBuf);
00575         MachineName = hostnameBuf;
00576     }
00577     Status = Util_StrDup(L->PS, MachineName, & (L->LoggerMachineName));
00578     if (FAILURE(Status))
00579         return Status;
00580 
00581     if (L->ChangeCallback)
00582         L->ChangeCallback(L->ChangeCallbackArg);
00583 
00584     return IPDR_OK;
00585 }

static IPDR_Status Log_SetLoggerAddressCommand (  ConsoleSession *  S,
FILE *  Out,
int  Argc,
const char *const   Argv[],
void *  Arg
)  [static]
 

Console function for setting the logger application address

Parameters:
S console session
Out output stream
Argc number of arguments
Argv arguments
Arg context argument (log)
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 
00515 {
00516     Log *L = (Log *) Arg;
00517     int Facility;
00518     const char* MachineName;
00519     IPDR_Status result;
00520     TL_PABuf paBuf;
00521 
00522     if (Argc < 2) {
00523         Console_Println(S, Out, "set_logger_addr: Invalid number of arguments.");
00524         return IPDR_OK;
00525     }
00526     if (Argc >= 3) {
00527         Facility = atoi(Argv[2]);
00528     } else {
00529         Facility = 1; /* local */
00530     }
00531     if (Argc >= 4) {
00532         MachineName = Argv[3];
00533     } else {
00534         MachineName = NULL;
00535     }
00536 
00537     result= Log_SetLoggerAddress(L, TL_ParseAddress(Argv[0]), atoi(Argv[1]), Facility, MachineName);
00538 
00539     if (SUCCESS(result)) {
00540         Console_Println(S, Out, "Logger Address=%.99s facility=%d machine=%.99s",
00541                         TL_PrintAddressAndPort(L->LoggerAddr, L->LoggerPort, paBuf),
00542                         L->LoggerFacility, L->LoggerMachineName);
00543     }
00544 
00545     return result;
00546 }

IPDR_DebugLevel  Level
) 
 

Set the current debug level of a specific module (only messages within lower or equal debug level will be outputted from the module)

Parameters:
L logger
Name module name
Level module debug level
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 
00241 {
00242     int i;
00243     Module *M;
00244 
00245     for (i = 0; i < L->Modules.Length; i++) {
00246         M = (Module *) L->Modules.Data[i];
00247         if (M == NULL || M->Name == NULL)
00248             continue;
00249         if (Name != NULL && ! strcmp(Name, M->Name))
00250             M->Level = Level;
00251     }
00252 
00253     if (L->ChangeCallback)
00254         L->ChangeCallback(L->ChangeCallbackArg);
00255 
00256     return IPDR_OK;
00257 }

IPDR_Status Log_VOutputStr (  Log *  L,
IPDR_ModuleID  ModuleID,
IPDR_DebugLevel  Level,
const char *  Func,
const char *  Str,
va_list  Args
) 
 

The function outputs a log message to the IPDR client (transmitter) log.

Parameters:
L logger
ModuleID module identifier (either IPDR_PLATFORM_MODULE_ID or IPDR_HOST_MODULE_ID)
Level message debug level
Func function originating the message
Str message (can be a printf style format string)
Args additional arguments in case of a formatted msg
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise. 
00339 {
00340     if (! Func) { Func = ""; }
00341     if (! Str) { Str = ""; }
00342 #if defined(VXWORKS) || defined(_VXWORKS)
00343     /* XXX #error VXWORKS problem (bug?) with vsprintf */
00344     vsprintf (L->msgStr, Str, Args);
00345 #elif _MSC_VER
00346     _vsnprintf (L->msgStr, LOG_MAX_MSG_SIZE, Str, Args);
00347 
00348     L->msgStr[LOG_MAX_MSG_SIZE-1] = '\0';
00349 #else
00350     vsnprintf (L->msgStr, LOG_MAX_MSG_SIZE, Str, Args);
00351     L->msgStr[LOG_MAX_MSG_SIZE-1] = '\0';
00352 #endif
00353 
00354     return Log_OutputMessage(L, L->msgStr, ModuleID, Level, Func);
00355 }

IPDR_Status Log_VOutputStrByName (  Log *  L,
const char *  ModuleName,
IPDR_DebugLevel  Level,
const char *  Func,
const char *  Str,
va_list  Args
) 
  

00359 {
00360     int i;
00361     Module *M;
00362 
00363     for (i = 0; i < L->Modules.Length; i++) {
00364         M = (Module *) L->Modules.Data[i];
00365         if (M == NULL || M->Name == NULL)
00366             continue;
00367         if (ModuleName != NULL && ! strcmp(ModuleName, M->Name)) {
00368                         if(Log_ShouldWrite(L, i, Level))
00369                 return Log_VOutputStr(L, i, Level, Func, Str, Args);
00370                         return IPDR_OK;
00371         }
00372     }
00373 
00374     if(Log_ShouldWrite(L, IPDR_PLATFORM_MODULE_ID, Level))
00375         return Log_VOutputStr(L, IPDR_PLATFORM_MODULE_ID, Level, Func, Str, Args);
00376         return IPDR_OK;
00377 }
